bibl.author: Walter Whitman Reynolds
bibl.title: Walter Whitman Reynolds to Walt Whitman, [?]
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p:
I received your letter of the 29th and was very glad to herehear from you I am very sorry to keep you waiting so long for my answer. we have just got done taking account of stock I have benbeen very busy for the last tootwo weeks. I am working in the same place. I am very tired when I get home at night my feet are very sore from the nails sticking up on the heels of my shoes I wish you a Merry Christmas I was very glad to get your Picture I think it looks very much like you I send you mine in return I have received the title of UnkleUncle
my sister Josephine has a little Boy he is one week old his name is John K. Crum he weigh ten pounds I am going to get my wages raised after the Holidays father has just received Employment In the pipe yard foot of 24th of East River mother & father send theretheir Regards this is all at present

closer.salute: With Love I remain your Affectionate friend
